basics.name: Edvard Hübinette
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: Versatile engineer experienced in startups where wearing many hats is the norm. Strong CS fundamentals with a knack for quickly picking up new tools and abstractions. Comfortable across the stack: from infrastructure and developer tooling to backend services, web3 protocol design, and smart contracts. A reliable fixer who leaves the campsite cleaner than they found it.

work.name: DeSci Labs
work.description: Building technologies for a radically accessible scientific record.
work.summary: Driving infrastructure moderinization, protocol architecture, and DX improvements across a distributed team.
highlights: Cut select cloud costs by ~90% by migrating to Nix-managed bare-metal servers
Spearheaded protocol redesign for decentralised scientific publishing
Reduced CI runtimes by 80% and created smoother development environments
Onboarding and mentored several new engineers on protocol and infrastructure
Implemented observability stack across Kubernetes clusters
Diagnosed and resolved multiple performance bottlenecks across the stack
Ran technical seminars and giving conference talks

work.name: Nortical
work.summary: Designed and implemented the majority of all infrastructure and services.
highlights: Designed and built cost efficient data pipelines on Google Cloud from scratch
Developed high-throughput data collection & processing pipeline in Elixir
Leveraged Nix for deterministic builds, checks, and development environments
Designed sturdy CI/CD workflows with GitHub Actions, Terraform, and Nix
Enabled 3x faster time-to-deploy for analytics team models
Built a routing layer using the Cloudflare serverless stack
Ran technical due-diligence sessions with investors

work.name: MakerDAO
work.summary: Creating resilient and performant services to support the Dai stablecoin.
highlights: Developed VulcanizeDB, a data caching and indexing service for Ethereum
Leveraged deep Ethereum VM knowledge to optimize data collection
Built high-throughput services in Go
Optimised database modelling and queries in PostgreSQL
Delivered major refactors for both performance and maintainability

work.name: Cacti AB
highlights: Worked on a global whistleblowing platform
Backend work in C#/ASP.NET, with a React/Redux frontend

work.name: Göteborg Energi
highlights: Working on a Python crawler for diagnosing the smart electrical grid
Learning hard truths about real-life networking issues

volunteer.summary: Reviewing speaker applications and finalizing track programming for DevCon 2019 in Osaka. DevCon is one of the biggest Ethereum developer conferences.

volunteer.position: Member of the Board of Advisors
volunteer.summary: Steering BioBlock funding decisions by performing technical review of grant proposals.
Board member for a restaurant group (14M+ EUR annual turnover), followed by a 560-unit housing association.

_publications.name: Better Implicit Parallelism
_publications.summary: MSc thesis on increasing the implicit parallelism in the Haskell compiler.

references.name: Sina Iman (CTO, DeSci Labs)
references.reference: I worked with Edvard as CTO, where I hired him as a Senior Software Engineer. He's a strong, dependable engineer who takes ownership, communicates clearly, and delivers high-quality work with consistency. He approaches complex problems very thoughtfully and is a reliable presence on any team. He's also a genuinely good person with high integrity and upbeat attitude, and I'd happily work with him again.

references.name: Niklas Kunkel (Backend Services Manager, MakerDAO)
references.reference: Edvard is a talented developer that any team could benefit from. He embodies the rare combination of a strong technical background, gifted communicator, and synergistic collaborator. He was able to pick up the codebase of one our projects quickly without much assistance, and started contributing improvements almost immediately, cementing himself as a keystone for the team. He has a keen eye for taking a step back and refactoring complex systems as they evolve. He’s self-directed and can be trusted to deliver comprehensive solutions even with minimal oversight. If given the opportunity, I would love to work with Edvard again.

references.name: Rob Mulholand (Principal Software Crafter, 8th Light)
references.reference: Edvard was a huge asset to our team [at MakerDAO]. He’s an extremely capable developer, with demonstrated ability to pick up new skills and complete tasks on time. But perhaps more importantly, he’s a great collaborator who pushed the team to drive out inefficiencies in our architecture and workflows. Edvard seamlessly onboarded into our technology stack, bringing fresh perspective and identifying bottlenecks that were difficult for the rest of us to see. In short order, he was taking ownership of big picture improvements that made our code more idiomatic and easier to change. The design improvements that he drove make our work easier to this day, months after he’s rolled off. I’d love the opportunity to work with him again, and know he’ll be a great benefit to any team.

projects.name: Summer of Haskell stipendiate
projects.description: Received a grant for programming language research on linear type systems
highlights: Documented in a short but popular blog series (see repo)
Community interaction in post discussion threads on Reddit

projects.name: Conference Talks
highlights: DeSci Berlin (2025) | Panel on Reproducible Research in DeSci
ResearchHub 'The Roast of DeSci' (2025) | Defended protocol design
IPFS Connect (2023) | Modelling the scientific record as a DAG
PL Summit (2023) | Lightning talk and 2-hour protocol deep-dive workshop

projects.name: Open source contributions
projects.description: Upstream contributions and maintained packages across the ecosystem
highlights: Contributions to IPFS, rust-ceramic, GHC, cloudflare-exporter, autorandr, etc
Maintaining AUR packages
